derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: of unknown origin; perhaps ultimately related to mote

entry.def: You can describe a group of things as a motley collection if you think they seem strange together because they are all very different.

example.ex: ...a motley collection of vans, old buses, cattle-trucks, and even a fire engine...
example.tran: 杂七杂八的一堆车，有运货车、旧公共汽车、运牛车，甚至救火车

example.ex: The volunteers seem a motley crew.
example.tran: 志愿者里似乎什么人都有。

means.word_mean: 1. a collection containing a variety of sorts of things;

sentences.sentence: "a great assortment of cars was on display"

means.word_mean: 2. a garment made of motley (especially a court jester's costume)
3. a multicolored woolen fabric woven of mixed threads in 14th to 17th century England
1. make something more diverse and varied;
2. make motley; color with different colors
1. consisting of a haphazard assortment of different kinds (even to the point of incongruity);

sentences.sentence: "a mixed program of baroque and contemporary music"
"sundry sciences commonly known as social"- I.A.Richards

means.word_mean: 2. having sections or patches colored differently and usually brightly;
